intro: Hesperis fasciculata, commonly known as the clustered honesty, is a flowering plant in the Brassicaceae family. It is native to the western United States and is characterized by its clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features linear, grass-like leaves. It blooms from late spring to early summer, and its seed pods split open to release small, rounded seeds. Hesperis fasciculata is often found in open habitats such as meadows and rocky slopes.
